notes: Data from February 5, 2016. The health facilities, entry points, and vulnerable sites (markets, bus stations, migrant worksites, schools and places of worship) dataset contains information about the geographic location (x,y,z coordinates) of the site; name; locality; status, access to water, electricity and communication network; field accessibility, estimated number of visitors per day,  estimated number of visitors on busy day; estimated number of international visitors per day, main origin and main destination; presence of health screening; community volunteers; health officers. Border sub-prefectures of Forécariah and Kindia (near the border of Sierra Leone) have been surveyed by IOM and INS (National Institute of Statistics) in October 2015. Collected information has been given by key informants on sites and checked during participatory mapping exercises led at the sub-prefecture level.
